title: The End Of The F**king World’s Jessica Barden nearly didn’t return for season 2
text:
Jessica Barden plays Alyssa in The End Of The F**king World (Picture: Channel 4)

The End Of The F**king World is set to return for a second season, but lead star Jessica Barden had doubts about coming back at all.

The 27-year-old actress plays Alyssa in the Channel 4 series, with the first season seeing the character run away with wannabe psychopath classmate James (Alex Lawther) to escape their complicated home lives.

The second season picks up two years after the first season cliffhanger, where Alex is shot by police as he attempts to make a run for the ocean.

Speaking to Metro.co.uk, Jessica revealed she initially questioned returning for a second outing before she knew about the time jump.

‘I wasn’t going to do this, I just realised,’ Jessica said about season two. ‘It’s not like I wasn’t going to do it, but I did have a really long time, about a year before I came back and did it, I did start to feel insecure about it because I felt I was so much older than the characters.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I think the only thing that writer Charlie Covell told me in advance was she was making the character older to deal with more adult things. Because I was kind of like, I can’t really play a teenager anymore. So she told me that side of it.’

Jessica Barden and Naomi Ackie as Bonnie (Picture: Channel 4)

The announcement of a second season was also met with some scepticism considering how well the first worked as a standalone series – although Jessica explained how she embraced the pressure.

‘Living up to expectation is a huge part of having a successful career so I don’t think any of us wanted it to get like in the way of just being in the moment and enjoying the experience,’ Jessica said.

‘We were aware there was an expectation about it, but if you want to have a successful career that’s something you always want to be present in your work.’

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

She added: ‘This is actually really easy to make because the scripts are really good, so it’s really easy to be in the moment.

‘It’s not a show that you really plan or think about doing because obviously Charlie, her skill is writing 50 lines of dialogue in about five words, so you can’t really think about it too much otherwise it wouldn’t really work.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Joining Alyssa this time around is newcomer Bonnie, played by Naomi Ackie who is also starring in Star Wars: The Rise Of Skywalker.

The End Of The F**king World season 2 kicks off 4 November on Channel 4.

description: Jessica Barden has explained how she felt 'insecure' about returning to the show.
